Chat to Dayan around this (taken from wikipedia)
In April 2013, IBM announced that the WebSphere Message Broker product was undergoing another rebranding name change.[4] The WMB product version for the new product name of IBM Integration Bus is 9 and includes new nodes such as the Decision Service node which enables content based routing based on a rules engine and requires IBM WebSphere Operational Decision Management product.[5] The IBM WebSphere Enterprise Service Bus product has been discontinued with the release of IBM Integration Bus and IBM is offering transitional licenses to move to IBM Integration Bus.[6]

data.Description: Requirements management system. Determines the requirements needed to complete a specific transactions. When outstanding requirements are received it will associate the requirement to the document received. Does not poll input handling to see what has arrived. Input handling must tell it what is has. Also, a system needs to tell it what transaction it is trying to complete and it will provide the list of requirements needed. It has no knowledge of what is currently available for reuse.
(Mats and Surr leads)
